subject: Languages
title: Linear B: A Bronze Age Surprise
description: A short lesson to help you apply Linear B: A Bronze Age Surprise.

hook.text: For 50 years, nobody could read the script found on ancient tablets in Crete. The answer shocked everyone.

buildup.text: Arthur Evans discovered Linear B tablets at Knossos in 1900 and assumed they were in an unknown language.

discovery.text: In 1952, amateur cryptographer Michael Ventris proved Linear B was an early form of Greek.

twist.text: Ventris was an architect, not a linguist. Professional scholars had failed for half a century.

climax.text: His decipherment pushed Greek history back 600 years to 1450 BCE and revealed Mycenaean bureaucracy.
